snippet: Egypt began three days of official mourning after at least 73 people were killed in a soccer brawl that underscored the interim government’s failure to re-establish order.
abstract: Police in several Egyptian cities battle with thousands of die-hard soccer fans angry at the military-led government’s failure to prevent the deaths of over 70 people at a soccer riot in Port Said, Egypt; many protesters say they believe that the Interior Ministry meant to retaliate against the Cairo soccer fans because of their leading role in several violent battles with the police at protests beforehand.
lead_paragraph: Egypt began three days of official mourning after at least 73 people were killed in a soccer brawl that underscored the interim government’s failure to re-establish order.

headline.seo: Egyptian Protesters Unleash Anger After Soccer Violence
headline.main: In Clashes With Police, Egyptians Unleash Fury Over Soccer Riot Deaths
headline.print_headline: In Clashes With Police, Egyptians Unleash Fury Over Soccer Riot Deaths
